intro: Hieracium porrifolium subsp. pseudoporrifolium, commonly known as the false radish hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves that are typically lobed or toothed. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is often found in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring temperate climates. Its subspecies status highlights subtle differences in leaf morphology and habitat preference compared to other Hieracium species.
